channel.title: Comments on: Programmers Who Care About The Environment…
channel.description: Amit Schreiber's Blog | הבלוג של עמית שרייבר

item.title: By: Amit
item.dc:creator: Amit
item.description:
Hehe... well, I guess you're right. The carbon footprint of an interpreted language programmer is much smaller. But you should really take a look at the new C++. It's awesome... like a new toy to play with :)
And, of course, it was a joke. Just something I thought about when I realized the software I'm currently writing could have been written much faster in some scripting language :S
item.content:encoded:
Hehe… well, I guess you’re right. The carbon footprint of an interpreted language programmer is much smaller. But you should really take a look at the new C++. It’s awesome… like a new toy to play with :)

And, of course, it was a joke. Just something I thought about when I realized the software I’m currently writing could have been written much faster in some scripting language :S

item.title: By: Ronen
item.dc:creator: Ronen
item.description: ok, ill pick up the glove, and what if the time needed to write a code in an interpreted language is 10% of the time needed to do so in a compiler based language? what about the resources the programmer may waste while coding?(food, electricity, water, other people's sanity etc...) interpreted languages are greener then anything else!
item.content:encoded:
ok, ill pick up the glove, and what if the time needed to write a code in an interpreted language is 10% of the time needed to do so in a compiler based language? what about the resources the programmer may waste while coding?(food, electricity, water, other people’s sanity etc…)
interpreted languages are greener then anything else!
